April 2, 1906                                             MS 33, 1906 


                                     Sanitarium, Cal.,March 20, '06 


                         The Chicago Work 


     During the general meeting held here in June 1902, I attended three meetings in the Sanitarium Chapel. I had a decided message to bear to the people. A heavy burden rested upon me to make a clear statement of the principles that should be followed in our medical missionary work. I was very thankful that Judge Arthur 
                                                                           50
was present to hear the message that the Lord had given me. I asked the Lord to help, and was assured of His presence.
